intro: Matelea borinquensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Matelea borinquensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is considered a rare and endemic species.
